title.narrative: PUBLIC WATER UTILITIES INCREASED CAPACITIES TO ENSURE UNINTERRUPTED WATER SUPPLY

description.narrative: By 2022, Public Water Utility Companies and Municipalities in conflict-affected areas have increased capacities to ensure uninterrupted water supply and sanitation services to population, which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Reducing Child Poverty, Reducing Child Poverty (Covid), Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, all children in conflict-affected settings have access to safe drinking water and reduced exposure to any environmental risks.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, Public Water Utility Companies and Municipalities in conflict-affected areas have increased capacities to ensureuninterrupted water supply and sanitation services to population

description.narrative: UNICEF&39;s efforts over the past 5 years to make the needs of the huge water utilities in Eastern Ukraine visible are bearing fruit, with increasing involvement of national authorities and more substantial financial investments (grants or loans) from bi-lateral donors or financial institutions, with a clear perspective of ensuring sustainable access to WASH services. UNICEF has continued to provide physical (rehabilitation or provision of equipment) and managerial (water system management software) support to the utilities. Complementarily, technical and managerial capacity strengthening of rural non-centralized systems has been initiated, complementing the rehabilitation activities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:21/01/2022
